word.description: As in English, {橙} denotes both the [fruit](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orange_(fruit)) and the [color](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orange_(colour)).

images.place: Wendy's Noodle Cafe, Las Vegas, Nevada

description: [Oranges](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orange_(fruit)) originated in China and neighboring regions. [Mandarin oranges](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mandarin_orange) in particular are a traditional gift/offering during Chinese New Year, because the Cantonese word for Mandarin orange, 柑 (gām) sounds like the word for gold, 金 (gām).

word.description: {菠蘿} is [pineapple](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pineapple), and {汁} is *juice*, so 菠蘿汁 is [pineapple juice](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pineapple_juice).
{蔗} is [sugarcane](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sugarcane), and {汁} is *juice*, so {蔗汁} is [sugarcane juice](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sugarcane_juice).

description: [Sugarcane juice](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sugarcane_juice) is a (very sugary) liquid made from pressed [sugarcane](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sugarcane).

word.description: Apple [cider](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cider) is known in Cantonese by a loanword {西打} pronounced sāi dá, and in Mandarin by a more literal {蘋果酒]} ({蘋果} is *apple*, and {酒} is *alcohol*, so 蘋果酒 is *apple alcohol*).
